content.description: Instead of following the lip right, just finish onto the slab the roof seam takes you to. The topout is over a sketchy hillside drop.
content.location: This is a fairly big roof on the north hillside, just after the big bolted boulder (Apocrypha Boulder). The boulder can be seen at times from the trail and is only a couple minutes off the trail.

content.description: Sit with a high right hand jug and a lower left hand crimp. Follow the good crack to the lip, and traverse the lip right to finish. This finish keeps things pretty safe.
content.location: This is a fairly big roof on the north hillside, just after the big bolted boulder (Apocrypha Boulder).  The boulder can be seen at times from the trail and is only a couple minutes off the trail.

content.description:
Sit with a good right and a low left. Top out above and left, the same as

Fantabuloustic Enterprises

.
content.location: This boulder hides under the trail, to the right, and is just before all the other problems. You hike over the slab that the lines topout onto.  None of the lines are very worthwhile, but it is there.

content.description: SDS at a good ledge and throw for a good edge above. Top out at the point.
content.location: This boulder hides under the trail, to the right, and is just before all the other problems. You hike over the slab that the lines topout onto.  None of the lines are very worthwhile, but it is there.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Slingshot

, but traverse right to finish at the scoop.
content.location: This boulder hides under the trail, to the right, and is just before all the other problems. You hike over the slab that the lines topout onto.  None of the lines are very worthwhile, but it is there.

content.description: Nice ledges make this so easy until the end.
content.location: It is on the right side of the trail just before the huge boulder with the bolt (Apocrypha Boulder).

content.description: Match the jug left handhold, and climb left into a dabby finish over the slab below. The original direct finish is better.
content.location: This boulder lies between the Slingshot Boulder and the big bolted boulder (Apocrypha Boulder).  The trail passes right next to the boulder's peak, but the climb is over the creek and hidden from view.

content.description: This is a cool little overhanging compression rig. Sit with your right hand on the lowest good part of the lip and your left hand on a good, incut crimp on the far left. A small right hand bump to a better lip hold starts the climb and makes room for a heel hook. Plan to tie back some foliage, otherwise the landing and problem maybe a bit awkward.
content.location: This boulder lies between the Slingshot Boulder and the big bolted boulder (Apocrypha Boulder). The trail passes right next to the boulder's peak, but the climb is over the creek and hidden from view.

content.description: Stand start at the smaller northwest overhang just below a section of the lip where a good ledge hold leads onto the slab. On the overhang, utilize a poor, left hand sloper a foot below the lip and a far right, small, crimp sidepull. Pull on and establish, then throw for the lip. Mantel, and finish up the easy slab.

Stand at the corner that divides the two large overhangs with a high left sloper and a flatish scoop at the lip. Traverse the lip right to finish up the slab above the jug ledge. The slab is very tall but easy.
content.location: This is on the huge bolted boulder that the trail passes under.
